alert.note: Alert for Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 10:02PM EST until January 29 at 8:30PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Large stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Ohio, including the following counties, Athens, Gallia, Lawrence, Meigs, Morgan and Washington and West Virginia, including the following counties, Jackson, Mason, Pleasants and Wood. * WHEN...Until 500 AM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, large creeks and streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1000 PM EST, gauge reports indicated flooding along the rivers and larger streams, including the Little Muskingum River, the Shade River, and Duck Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Beverly, Rio Grande, Albany, Coolville, Rutland, Chesterhill, Forked Run State Park, Vienna, Williamstown, New Haven and Mason. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
